body: How are you running the GRPC server (what implementing language, any particular example/interop test, was the server being run initialized as a secure server, etc.)?

It's a custom server.  I was reading that there are some options to pass in CERT info.  That was not happening and might be part of the problem.  If so, it can simply be an issue of hooking up the certs.  I haven't verified this yet.  It is a server written in node 0.10.40.  I was just launching the server using `node server.js`.  The server seems to work with the grpc client connecting to it, but I can't connect to it with openssl or the node-http2 library due to the problem mentioned in the title of the issue.

Same for grpc-go: 

```
    bind := fmt.Sprintf("%s:%d", this.Config.Rpc.Host, this.Config.Rpc.Port)
    lis, err := net.Listen("tcp", bind)
    if err != nil {
        log.Fatalf("failed to listen: %v", err)
    }

    opts := []grpc.ServerOption{
    }
    grpcServer := grpc.NewServer(opts...)
    err = grpcServer.Serve(lis)
```

but can't access local server:

```
/usr/local/Cellar/curl/7.45.0/bin/curl --http2 -v https://localhost:8060                     
* Rebuilt URL to: https://localhost:8060/

* Cipher selection: ALL:!EXPORT:!EXPORT40:!EXPORT56:!aNULL:!LOW:!RC4:@STRENGTH

  CApath: none
* TLSv1.2 (OUT), TLS header, Certificate Status (22):
* TLSv1.2 (OUT), TLS handshake, Client hello (1):

* Closing connection 0
curl: (35) error:140770FC:SSL routines:SSL23_GET_SERVER_HELLO:unknown protocol
```

hello neo4j user~
In bolt protocol, port number is not `7474` but `7687` as default.
so if you fix code like below, the problem may be resolve.

```
var driver=neo4j.driver("bolt://localhost:7687", neo4j.auth.basic("neo4j14", "neo4j"));
```
good luck
